segments.text: I can hardly believe my eyes when I look at the woman by the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just standing there, calmly drying a plate, completely motionless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is absolutely gushing over the edge of the sink onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is literally in a growing puddle, and she shows no sign of noticing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me so angry to see such a lack of awareness in an adult.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she hear the running water, or feel the cold on her foot?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then, there are the children, almost tumbling over trying to steal cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's her responsibility to keep them safe, and she's failing spectacularly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy could easily fall and hit his head on the counter.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone is going to slip on that wet floor, it's inevitable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This entire situation is just a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout at her, to make her turn around and see what's happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her serene expression just adds insult to injury at this point.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of detachment is frankly astonishing and quite frustrating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What an absolute mess this kitchen is about to become, all because of one person's obliviousness.
segments.speaker: PAR
